definition: to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Phase evolution was studied by the synchrotron radiation photoemission technique.
sentences.chinese: 用同步辐射光电子能谱研究了相衍变过程。

sentences.english: The Shaanxi Opera is also a blow to the Evolution cavity.
sentences.chinese: 现在的秦腔也是吹腔衍变来的。

sentences.english: Microvariations, or mutations, are considered to be slight changes of the historical record.
sentences.chinese: 微变异或突变可以认为是物种衍变历史记录中的一页。

sentences.english: Chaoshan if this is the ancient Chinese language in the Central Plains to wave a product of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 潮汕话本是古代中原汉人语言在潮地衍变的产物。

sentences.english: But the occurrence of the calligraphy style is also the inevitable result which the font continues to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 而书体的发生又是书风持续衍变的必然结果。

sentences.english: Liu Bei's personal character also plays an active role in the evolution.
sentences.chinese: 刘备个人的政治品格也在衍变中起了积极影响。

definition: to evolve (of ideas, designs, constructions etc)/to develop and change
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
(of insects) to undergo metamorphosis/(fig.) to be transformed/to metamorphose/to become degraded
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to be born/(fig.) to develop out of sth else (of ideas, stories, political systems etc)/(fig.) to shed one's body (to be reborn)/bodiless (e.g. lacquerware)
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
